intro: Peperomia nervosa, commonly known as the veined peperomia, is a compact evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of South America. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves with prominent veins that give it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–15 centimeters and features small, pale green or white flowers that appear in clusters. It thrives in bright, indirect light and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for indoor gardening. Peperomia nervosa is relatively low-maintenance and resistant to pests, contributing to its appeal among plant enthusiasts.
